content:
Thanks much Matt for your quick response:

Outgoing Server (SMTP) Settings: Details of selected server: Description: Google Mail - dbotas Server Name: smtp.gmail.com Port: 465 User Name: dbotas@gmail.com Authentication method: OAuth2 Connection Security: SSL/TLS

content: Unless you have some very dodgy internet which drops out frequently, the issue is probably an antivirus program than thinks it needs to scan email. Disable that and see if things improve.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Matt

Well you were right about the AV issue! THANKS! Apparently when I checked your suggestion I found my AV lapsed so I renewed my BitDefender and that took care of the issue. A BIG thanks!

Since you seem to be email auth knowledgeable, I have another similar question that has been going on for some time ... years actually I am embarassed to admit... unlike my gmail issue which was only a week old

My original two email accts in my life were paid dial-in accts on ATT.net and while I have switched mostly to gmail I still have those two att.net accts which some of my old contacts still use now and then so I also have them set up in TBird.

And for the most part they work... they send and receive. but every time there is a download /receive command generated for those accts I get a irritating "Enter your password for ####@att.net on imap.mail.att.net etc etc" error message that pops up

If I send from one of the ATT.net accts I get a "Your message was sent but a copy was not placed in your sent folder (Sent) due to network or file access errors. You can retry or save the message locally to Local Folders/Sent-####@att.net"

A few years ago att.net farmed out the admin of their free legacy att.net email accounts to Yahoo who admins them on a "att.net" webmail site. And at that time when setting them up in a Thunderbird client on Win you had to Generate a passkey to make it work.

( ATT Passkey Instructions: https://www.att.com/support/article/email-support/KM1240308 )

Which I did a back then but then after a while these error messages started popping up and there literally is no accessible tech support at either att.net or yahoo either for those now free legacy accts (beyond those instructions) so I have just lived with the constant irritation of the constant popup errors.

It must be some kind of auth issue ... but its not an AV one... it seems to be a config or auth issue... but I don't know how to figure it out.

Offhand with your savvy experience, do you recognize what it might be?

Not to worry if you don't ... u solved my critical problem with gmail... which was WAY more important.

Much thanks,

Dan
creator: dbotas

content: Thank you, Matt. That solved the problem. And in such a short amount of time!

content:
This isn't a Thunderbird issue, but I respect the problem. A common problem is for self-hosted domains, where the hosting server does not have the account properly secured. Issues such as content, wording, sending IP address, and server security all roll into the issue. For more info, I suggest you try a search engine with a search such as 

    how to prevent sent emails from going to spam

I did that and a number of helpful websites popped up.

content:
Thunderbird is on 128 now, it would be unusual for a Linux distribution not to be offering the most recent version. I suggest you try it as a number of performance changes are included.

Secondly indexing is something of a known performance hog and it is generally suggested folk disable the global indexer when trying to work out these sorts of issues. See https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Testing:Memory_Usage_Problems


I do not see changing to maildir as a solution. However see https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/maildir-thunderbird
creator: MattAuSupport

creator: rsbrux

content:
P.S. According to https://www.betterbird.eu/ the Betterbird homepage: >> Note that Thunderbird 128 and hence Betterbird 128 is shipping with a broken backend, causing IMAP folder corruption under some circumstances. Currently, we do not recommend version 128 for productive use. Show more

History: In December 2023 the Thunderbird team greatly changed the internals of mbox file handling, introducing a number of regressions. Soon after, the first bug was filed, reporting IMAP folder corruption. Currently, this bug is tracking the issue.

Symptoms: IMAP folder corruption is easy to notice. The user clicks on a message, and the message isn't correctly display. Usually some raw message content is displayed, often a MIME boundary starting with --. Some users report that a different mail from the one that was clicked on in the message list is displayed. Note that since the Thunderbird folks forced version 128 onto unsuspecting users via an unnecessary update, they are getting a high volume of reports that people's e-mail can't be displayed any more.

Remedy: Repairing the affected IMAP folder (Right-click, Properties, Repair Folder) usually fixes the issue. That's fine for users with little data, it causes problems for users with large folders (more than 1 GB) since the repair downloads all messages again. Some Thunderbird users report that they need to repair they IMAP mailboxes multiple times per week.

Outlook: We were estimating that the problem would be fixed in version 128.3.0 due in October 2024, but the Thunderbird team have done precious little to address the issue. It is possible that 128.3.0 will still be defective. As a recap, Thunderbird 102 initially shipped with a broken backend, including causing data loss; Thunderbird 115 "Supernova-kaboom" shipped with a broken frontend; now in Thunderbird 128 we're back to a broken backend. Breaking news: Mozilla will support the 115 series until 115.21 in March 2025. Maybe Thunderbird 128 will be stable by then. << Perhaps this is why my Linux distro hasn't yet updated Thunderbird to version 128.
creator: rsbrux

content: Hopefully they are better now

content:
I installed betterbird 115.17.0-bb35 (flatpak) in a freshly installed Ubuntu Studio 24.04.1 LTS and followed the instructions in the README on github github to migrate my 9.5GB non-flatpak Thunderbird profile to betterbird. Despite starting betterbird with the appropriate profile using the -p option as recommended, betterbird spent hours re-downloading everything. Other than that, however, I am experiencing no performance problems and the new platform appears to be stable.

P.S. I originally opened betterbird from Konsole in order to use the -p option, as recommended in the README. When I closed betterbird and reopened it from the Application Launcher, the downloading began anew. Also, the changes I had made in the Config Editor in the command-line session were lost.

P.P.S. The profile appears to be corrupted. Is there some way to repair it *without" opening betterbird?

creator: sfhowes

content:
Well, it's a never ending challenge, depending on the creativity of users. The simple approach would be to add this in config editor

Set pref.privacy.disable_button.view_passwords to true

That hides it UNLESS they know the primary signin password for Windows, as that resets the value to false.

and if they're sneaky, they will discover the config issue and change to false.

And to prevent that, you could create a folder named distribution in the folder where Thunderbird.exe lives and add a file named policies.json with this content:

{ 

 "policies": {     "BlockAboutConfig": true       }

}

to prevent accessing config editor, but then you run into the person discovering this trick and deleting the folder in program files. And then you're into looking into Windows security features to disable viewing the program files directory. It's a stack of dominoes. The above mentioned steps may work, depending on how desperately the people want the passwords. Another solution, if availalble, would be to use app passwords that are unique to the PC, eliminating entire problem. I'm think of Gmail, but there are others. Good luck. I encourage some experimentation prior to any rollout.
creator: davidsk

FOLKS! You're not going to believe this! I walked away from my PC for about 30 minutes after I started this additional info post to pace back and forth while I pulled my hair out. I sat back down to finish composing this and as an afterthought, went back to Thunderbird and ALL my contacts are now visible!! Am I losing my mind?

Whatever, I'm a happy boy! If I were a drinking man, I would go have a great big stiff shot right about now!

content: You didn't share the details, but if you are creating accounts, and then exiting and restarting to find no accounts, there is a high likelihood that the prefs.js file in profile is being prevented from updating when thunderbird closes. Why that is happening I don't know, possibly an antivirus. You might check in the profile folder to see if there are multiple prefs.js files, as that would be a clue.
creator: davidsk

content: Do you have multiple prefs.js files in the profile? Is the prefs.js marked as read-only? I have no solution, but something is preventing an update.

content: What more can i do?
creator: Nicky.richter85

content:
Are you running a VPN? Do you run any antivirus? Maybe an autobackup utility? To save what you have, this may work: '

  1. exit thunderbird
  2. in profile, delete all prefs.js except the one with the highest number
  3. rename that one to prefs.js and restart thunderbird, as that may have the account info for you.

content:
Have you added the profile folder as an exception in ZA settings?

https://support.zonealarm.com/hc/en-us/articles/360060710091-Configuring-Scan-Exceptions
creator: sfhowes

content:
IN Zonealarms antivirus you can't add directories to ZA Virus exceptions. so it was not possible to add 'profile folder' as an exception in ZA settings

I did manage to add Thunderbird.exe to the exception but that is all i could do

this did make a huge difference - and made Thunderbird useable again even though moving files between folders is still slow and the application still gives Not Reposnding from time to time - which is a pain.
creator: mark_adlington

content:
Adding the exe file is some progress. The link in my first reply includes this:

"On-Access Scan, if you want to exclude the selected file(s)/folder(s) from on-access scans"

but it might not apply to all ZA versions. If there really is no such option, I'd suggest replacing ZA with the built-in Windows Security, at least temporarily, to see if there is a significant performance gain. Folder exclusions are definitely available with WS.
creator: sfhowes

content: My default browser Edge starts when Thunderbird opens requesting a donation. Every time I start my Thunderbird the ad pops up again and completely takes over my computer. what needs to be done to prevent Edge opening when be when ‘Thunderbird opens?
creator: edweinman4

content: Did you check your Spam/Junk/Bulk folder? If your accounts are POP, you'll have to check via webmail, as POP only downloads the Inbox.
creator: sfhowes

content: I contacted Thunderbird first because of the mystery of the empty email notification box. I get a window that pops onto the lower right hand of my monitor when a new email arrives. It most often gives the name of sender and the title. I am somewhat new to "Bitdefender" and I'm not sure I know what all it defends me from. But, I have also been getting incoming email notification windows that are devoid of any other information. As I wrote, it is an empty box. Up until knowing that I have not been getting PayPal invoices, I was thinking it was spam that was being intercepted. I don't know. Can you tell me that, since it is a Thunderbird notification, it is not some censorship on your part?
creator: dblieberum

content:
Are these notifications presented by the built-in option or by the Windows system notifications? The choice is in Settings/General/Incoming Mails.

TB doesn't censor anything, but your mail provider might apply spam filters before messages are downloaded in TB. That is why I suggest checking webmail.

Bitdefender might also have an anti-spam component. If you're unsure, try disabling or removing BD temporarily and apply the built-in Windows Security instead.
creator: sfhowes

content: Managed to get it sorted..

creator: sfhowes

content: Check to see if something is interfering with thunderbird files. What you describe indicates that the prefs.js file (the one that keeps all of that info), is not being allowed to update at closure of thunderbird. That is sometimes obvious if there are multiple prefs.js files in the profile. I have no solution, if that is happening, other than to suggest seeing if antivirus or other software is interrupting thunderbird at shut down.

content: I would help if I were more famiiar with vcard. Have you tried csv? If it must be vcard, my strategy would be to extract a vcard from Thunderbird and then see if it will import. If it does, then there may be some difference in the format to evaluate.

content: If you still have access to the Outlook account, I suggest exporting csv, as others have had success in importing csv. There also, I suggest first creating an export from thunderbird in csv so you can compare and adjust. CSV files are easily adjusted in a spreadsheet.

content:
It sounds like you've got the execrable threading switched on.

Press Alt-V and on the drop-down menu that appears click 'Sort by' and then 'Unthreaded,' which is next to the bottom.
